intro: Dolichandrone occidentalis, commonly known as the Western dolichandrone, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
